info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 16 at 12:25AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF BULLOCH AND CANDLER COUNTIES... At 1225 AM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm near Twin City, or 9 miles north of Metter, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...excessive cloud to ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...All outdoor activities should cease. Move indoors immediately. Some locations in the path of this storm include... Statesboro, Metter, Brooklet, Portal, Pulaski, Register, Nevils and Georgia Southern. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<45 MPH
info.instruction: Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
